title: :white_check_mark:   Registering new pictures
description:
There are two ways to register a picture. You can either **send picture in <#${picChannelId}>** or **use the `/reg-pic` command**.
​

fields.name: Sending pictures in a message
fields.value:
When sending one or multiple (Discord limit being 10) pictures in <#${picChannelId}>, the bot will automatically register them.

You can also add optional attributes such as a title, description, date or location. The default syntax is:
> title: <title>
> description: <description>
> date: <date>
> location: <location>
But the bot will easily detect typos, allowing some flexibility such as:
> da     <date>
> tillte  : <title>
> desc:<description>
​

fields.name: Using the `/reg-pic` command
fields.value:
You can also use the **`/reg-pic`** command to register pictures. The syntax is: ```
/reg-pic pic:<picture_attachment> [title:<title>] [description:<description>] [date:<date>] [location:<location>]
```
Once again, the title, description, date and location are optional.
​

fields.name: About attributes parsing
fields.value:
Because of some Discord limits, a title should be less than 100 characters long.

The date can be in any usual format such as `YYYY-MM-DD`, `DD/MM/YY`, `DD-MM-YYYY`, `MM.DD.YYYY`, `DD MMM YY`...

The location can be anything, as long as it is less than 100 characters long and preferably precise enough to represent a unique location.
